p: It has been reported that about 64% of the world population use herbal remedies for the treatment of various disorders (Farnsworth 2008). Moreover, nearly 50% of synthetic drugs are derived from phytochemicals (Newman and Cragg 2012). Herbs synthesize chemicals as a part of their defence system to combat pathogens; and a considerable number of such compounds are effective anti-infective agents. For example, naturally occurring hydroxylated phenols and flavonoids are effective against infections (Dixon etÂ al. 1983). Alkaloids, as the most common plant-based bioactive metabolites, as well as flavonoids have antifeedant and larvicidal effects (Levin and York 1978).
